content.description:
Windchill climbs a cool lip traverse on the right side of the main face of the Turnstile Boulder. 

  Start sitting with your hands matched on a good edge. Throw your right heel up and follow slopers leftward across the feature. I topped after about 10 feet, once I reached the good holds, mostly because I didn't feel comfortable traversing over the menacing adjacent boulder.   

  It'd be possible to continue the traverse across the whole lip, topping out at Don't Jump. Since the lip is pretty juggy, I don't think it would change the grade, but nonetheless it'd be a fun 30 foot traverse.

Don't Jump! climbs the left arete on the steep face of the Turnstile Boulders. It's one of those problems that could be easily negated with a quick hop off the ground. In order to get all the V points and all the style points, you must not push off the ground while doing the first move. Sounds classic, eh? 

  Once you figure out the initial standing beta (seriously), the problem does flow pretty well. Start left hand on the arete and right hand on a terrible crimp. Put left foot up on a crystal, ease yourself on and throw to the good crimp out right. Slap up the arete to finish the problem and top out by using a stylish heel hook out right.

climbs.name: The Catfish
climbs.fa: Matt Wallace, Jay Knower, Tim Armstrong 9/15/13

content.description:
Start on a good left hand crimp and a decent right hand side-pull about six feet off the ground. The starting holds are five feet right of the arete of Don't Jump!. 

  Grab the starting hold get a good high right foot, lock off and go for the lip to a nifty mantle.
content.location: Five feet to the right of Don't Jump!. With a good left hand crimp and a right hand side-pull.

content.description: This is a pair of long low boulders at the bottom of Skyfall. Though there isn't a lot of potential here, the truly creative might unearth more stuff.
